name: Lapis Blue Tansy Face Oil - For Oily & Acne-Prone Skin
about: What it is:A skin-soothing face oil that balances congested complexions while visibly smoothing and softening to a glowing finish..Skin Type:Normal, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Redness, Acne and Blemishes, and Oiliness.Formulation:Oil.Highlighted Ingredients:- Blue Tansy: Calms and soothes redness and visibly clarifies the complexion without drying..Ingredient Callouts:This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and gluten-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:This formula is made with pure plant oils to lock in hydration without clogging pores so that the skin can stop overcompensating and find the balance it needs. This product contains no fillers, is non-comedogenic, and is formulated without silicone. Lapis oil naturally varies from a deep blue to green color.
ingredients: -Blue Tansy: Calms and soothes redness and clarifies the complexion without drying..-Vegan Squalane: Supports the skinu2018s natural protective barrier to help lock in moisture..-Kukui Nut Oil: Helps balance surface sebum in blemish-prone skin. ..Squalane, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Aleurites Moluccanus Seed Oil, Tocopherol, Tanacetum Annuum Flower Oil, Jasminum Sambac (Jasmine) Flower Extract, Rosa Damascena Flower Extract.....The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply four to six drops of Lapis Blue Tansy Face Oil to cleansed and toned skin morning and night..-Massage in and allow to absorb for one to three minutes before applying makeup..-Store upright in a cool, dry place and out of direct sunlight...Recycling Instructions:.Place outer carton into paper recycling..Clean the pipette with warm water then gently remove it from the dropper by pulling downward, and recycle. Next, remove the soft bulb and discard it in the trash, but recycle the plastic collar. .Rinse the glass bottle thoroughly, and recycle.

reviews.review_text: I had to try applying this product using various methods, but after using for several months, I have seen results. Everyone's skin and personal preferences are very unique, so you may need to test out the best way to use for yourself because the recommended directions for use didn't work the best for me.  I apply at night mixed in with my moisturizer. I only use during the day if I'm not wearing makeup over it because it doesn't dry down well enough for me. Over time, I've noticed that my skin is less congested, doesn't produce as much sebum, and my pores look smaller/clearer. This oil does a good job with calming angry breakouts as well.  I have had my product for about 4 months now and have not experienced the mold/contamination that others have had an issue with. Hopefully this doesn't happen to too many other people because a little goes a long way with this oil and I will definitely get good use for a long time. reviews.review_text: I'm honestly torn about writing this review, because I do think this is a great face oil and it did really help clear up and maintain my skin. It smells nice and absorbs nicely. However, like other Herbivore products, the shelf life on this is precarious and it's easy for bacteria and/or mold to grow in the bottle.   I started to use a new product in addition to my Lapis oil that was supposed to cause some initial purging. I had a few bumps, but they went away quickly, and my skin was looking great, until one day I had cystic acne coming in, along with a bunch of small white bumps, and my skin looked ruddy. I quickly stopped using my new treatment, but nothing was improving. I was ready to go see a dermatologist, when I noticed there was a viscus yellow mold in the bottom of my Lapis bottle.   After some investigation, I found that in addition to the Cloud Lotion, most Herbivore oils have the minimum amount of preservative, which means while they are usually okay, if you were to forget to screw the cap tightly one night or if the dropper came in contact with bacteria, there is a chance it could fester and grow. So, basically I was rubbing mold and bacteria into my skin twice a day...  Within a few days of stopping the Lapis (and doing a lot of exfoliating and using retinol cream) my skin was looking much better and a few weeks out with some new products, my skin is back in a good place.   I do love Herbivore oils - they do really absorb nicely and smell great, but I can't really say they are worth the experience I went through. There are other clean brands that are a bit more shelf stable that work just as nicely.

reviews.review_text: This is one of the most frustrating products ever. When I first got it, it was the absolute BEST oil Iu2019ve ever used. It cleared my acne prone skin up almost immediately, and left me with glowing, perfect skin. When I was less than halfway through the bottle, I noticed a whitish-green viscous mass at the bottom of the bottle. It did not look like typical separation or anything, it definitely looked contaminated. I returned it and even an employee commented on how weird it looked. I got another one (from a different store in a different state) to give it another chance, and made sure when using it to keep it in a cold dark place (a skincare fridge outside of the bathroom), never touched the dropper to my hands or anything else, and washed my hands before use. I work in a sterile lab environment so I handled it like I would in lab to prevent contamination. Less than a month later, I saw more mold/bacteria accumulating in the bottom. This time I returned and didnu2019t repurchase. I canu2019t justify the price tag when the product gets contaminated so quickly and forces me to return it. I also will not put anything on my face containing an unknown contaminant like that.  I love natural products and herbivore products because they really do wonders for my skin, but the lack of any sort of preservative ruins this oil before I can use it all. Itu2019s so disappointing because the product is great but doesnu2019t last, even in the optimal environment I tried to provide for it. :(  If you do try it out, Iu2019d keep an eye on it to make sure that nothing starts growing in it.

reviews.review_title: People with oily/acne prone skin beware!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Sephora, please publish my review of this oil! I bought it to help with overall texture and appearance of my skin, at that point my skin was clear and without any breakouts, just a bit of texture and post-acne marks. First time I applied it at night and it felt very nice and absorbed into my skin very fast, I woke up in the morning glowing and my pores and acne marks seemed a bit better just after one use. So you can imagine how excited I got after seeing such quick results, I applied it again the following night expecting to wake up glowing again. I woke up with a lot of clogged pores/comedones  on my chicks and with 3 huge deep under the skin blemishes that were super painful and red. I freaked out and stopped using the oil immediately, babied my skin for a week using peels and AHA serum, then decided to give it another try just to make sure it was the oil that caused such damage. Used it at night, woke up with 3 new pimples on my chin and cheeks and I never get pimples on my chin. So long story short it does cause acne if you have oily skin because there is coconut oil listed as one of the ingredients, it`s extremely comedogenic and can`t be tolerated by oily/combo skin. Now it will take me at least 3 weeks to get rid of pimples and another 2 months for the marks to fade. With all that said, it does work great for my sister who has dry not acne prone skin, so just be careful and patch test before committing to buy it.

My redness is almost unnoticeable, my acne is almost completely gone (with the exception of a PMS zit or two, and those clear up twice as fast as they normally would), and all of my acne scars have faded to the point that they're barely visible! My pores have also shrunk, and my skin just??? GLOWS?? I've been getting compliments left right and center from people telling me how good and bright my skin is looking - something that has NEVER happened to me before. I am honestly in shock, this stuff is a new holy grail for me.  AND, I've been using this twice a day for two months and the bottle looks barely touched. Seriously, the oil is still above the diamond logo sticker. This stuff is so expensive but so, so worth it in my opinion - it's going to easily last me a year, probably more. I am honestly in shock about how much my skin has changed for the better!!

I am almost 40 and have skin like a teenager; my skin is very combination (like very oily, VERY dry), red, sensitive and I have scars from acne as a teenager. I did notice almost instantly that my skin felt smoother... less flakey, foundation went on like a dream... but I didn't start seeing the real benefits for about 4-6 weeks. My skin is more balanced, moisturized, less red and the scars may even very faintly be fading. I have spent an ungodly amount of money over the years trying any products that might help me just to give them away or throw them in the trash... I will definitely continue to repurchase this product when it runs out. Now some cons, just to be fair. The product is thick and it sits on my face/doesn't absorb quickly. I am now only using this at night and am using a different dryer oil/serum mix in the mornings before foundation. This product also smells bad... like fish oil. If you've ever taken the Omega 3-6-9 oil capsules... well, you can smell a resemblance, but it fades quickly. Lastly, despite what some other reviewers said... I will go through this quickly. My dry skin soaks this stuff up and I have to use 7-10 drops each night. In 6 weeks I've put a noticeable dent in the bottle. When I read other reviews, I thought this bottle could last me 6 months to a year, now I will be happy with 4 months before rebuying.  I have seen other reviewers mention breaking out after using this... my advice is if this happens to you, stick with it! My acne has NOTICEABLY improved... but it took a few weeks (with some bumps in the road on the way - pun intended). I would recommend anyone who has suffered with difficult skin to try this product out!

reviews.review_text: I LOVE Herbivore. While it is pricey, and I was super reluctant to buy it, I used the Blue Tansy Mask and had to try the oil. It was totally worth the cost. I have a lot of redness from acne and it helps to calm that. I use it every day after cleansing and using Lush Rose Toning Water and twice a week with the Blue Tansy mask and the same Rose Water.

reviews.review_title: holy grail for acne-prone, oily skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Can't say enough good about this product - I suffered from horrible acne after pregnancy (still severe 4 months later) and this started to clear me up within a week. It's the number one product I recommend for acne-prone skin. Leaves the skin soft and smooth - don't worry if you're oily (I am too) because the jojoba resembles sebum and 'tricks' the skin into creating less (and hence less breakouts). Definitely pair with exfoliants - I like the Pixi glow tonic or the FAB intensive peel mask.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This oil is really all about balance. I wasn't looking for anything special since there are so many oils that claim to do this and that.  This oil does THIS AND THAT. OMG.  I will be repurchasing. This leaves my face so smooth and my pores are  visibly reduced. The smell is very light and the oil is very lightweight. I recommend this oil and I will repurchase.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this a month ago and have noticed a major improvement in my skin tone.  I have the beginnings of rosacea and this has helped calm and lessen the redness.  I am a true believer in any Herbivore product!!  So happy to have found this product!

reviews.review_title: thicker oil than i am used to.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is definitely a thicker oil than i am used to, which means a little goes a long way, but i also hate the smell, seems like this brand has some horrifying smells (and trust me, not any smell ever bothered me in my 28 year period as this brand does). Its a very hydrating oil, but it didnt do any better to me as the oils that i tried so far, therefore i will stick to my favorite oils that also do cost less. I gave it 4 stars and would recommend this, cuz overall it is a good oil that hydrates your skin greatly, just not for me or my skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this oil and will repurchase again and again if I ever finish the bottle! I've had this since March and I'm only halfway through the bottle. I use 2-3 drops twice a day. Great coverage and it has completely taken the redness out of my skin and has helped repair my acne scarring.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: A little bit goes a long way! Amazing product, it lasts a long time if used properly. Very moisturizing while not making your skin to oily. I would give this product a try and if you don't like to return it, because this is a must have.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I started using this product along with their Blue Tansy mask and their Jasmine Green Tea balancing toner and so far so good! :) My acne has almost disappeared and my skin feels firm and hydrated. Love it!

One of the BEST products for acne prevention. I used to get moderate break outs during my period, but this oil is a game CHANGER. Not only does it cure existing acne but it prevents future break outs. I feel like this would be a great product for people who get hormonal based break outs. It's also super gentle on sensitive skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product. I originally tried it thinking that it was a spot treatment, but it is an all over, llong term ue face oil. I have oily, acne prone skin and this helped to balance out the oil production. Once I run out of my Korres Brightening oil, I'm switching to this one because it's more appropriate for my skin type and also all natural.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This face oil is my holy grail! I started using it back in September of 2016. I'm just about ready to finish up my second bottle and start my third bottle by the end of this month (September 2017). It's definitely helped with any dry patches on my skin, any uneven texture and redness. It's mostly helped with my hormonal acne as well. I used to break out with 7-10 mini bumps on my forehead or cheeks during my cycle, but now I rarely get any zits! Maybe the occasional one or two. I've also gotten so many compliments on my skin this past year. I like to pair this oil up with a Vitamin C serum by Mad Hippie so that probably helps with the glow and smoothness as well. I've definitely recommended this oil to friends and one recently said that the oil helps with her recent acne scars as well! This oil is pricey, but I'm a firm believer that you shouldn't skimp on pampering your skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: One of my favorites- does not clog my pores, completely gets rid of the redness of my cheeks and forehead, reduced breakouts and calms down any irritations.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely ADORE this oil! I have combination skin so in some areas my face is breaking out and in others my face is flaky and dry. I bought this for the amazing reviews before Sephora even had it. This stuff works wonders. If my skin is breaking out I put this on at night and in the morning my skin is clear and not red!! My bf loves this stuff as well. Probably the one product of my skincare I cant live without. I know its pricey but it is worth every penny.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So I recently purchased this because mu U.F.O. Sunday Riley clarifying oil is not only no longer working for me but i feel like its just further clogging my pores. I just used this tonight following the Herbivore Blue Tansy mask. My skin feels so refreshed. I have oily, acne prone and VERY sensitive skin so most of these aha/bha masks break me out. But this one is SO gentle, I do feel a little tingle but i have faith since their products dont have perfume and artificial coloring. The ufo oil is very thick and doesnt move around my face easily. This oil glides on my face and leaves it feeling soft and hydrated.

First of all this oil smells AMAZING. Like a relaxing herbal tea. I am in love with its scent. It is very calming both for the mind and the skin. I do have redness on my face but after using this oil for about a month now (in conjunction with the Phoenix oil and my regular skin care) I no longer have redness on my skin. It has not caused any irritation or breakouts on my sensitive, dry, acne prone skin. The only down side I will say is that this is not a very moisturizing oil. But I have extremely dry skin so it's not the oils fault. I just layer my moisturizer and another oil over this. So I think if you have normal or even oily skin you will love this facial oil. I can't recommend this any more. It's a wonderful product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I thought my skin had a great complexion when I used this oil. However, seriously this oil has the most pungent smell ever! I literally feel like puking....... unbearable........ I was really looking forward to it and really wanted to like it. But the smell is just so unbearable for me........

reviews.review_title: a must for sensitive, acne prone skin
reviews.review_text: Wow. Wow. Wow. This is just amazing. I use three drops in the morning and three at night. It sinks in quickly and leaves me with an amazing glow. It keeps my skin calm and helps minimize any inflamed pimples. Usually you have to trade off between hydration or clogged pores. Becuase it uses squalene which is not occlusive, it doesn't clog my pores like shea or coconut oil do, but keeps me just as plump. I love it and cannot wait to see how my skin keeps improving as I use up the bottle. If you have red combo skin that needs some balance, BUY IT!

Over time, this has become my go-to daytime face oil. I didn't like it at first because I didn't think it did any better than my old facial oil (Laura Mercier rose oil) but after consistent use I can honestly say this oil has improved my skin.  I layer 3-4 drops over essence, BHA, and hydrating serum--this is my last step before makeup primer-- it sinks in within minutes and makes a great base for makeup! It does not make my face feel greasy, and over time I've noticed that it's visibly helped regulate my skin's oil production.   The oil blend is appropriate for oily/breakout prone skin.. Some of them are known to prevent irritation and none of the ingredients have appeared to clog my pores. Over 2 years I've seen my skin get less oily while becoming more radiant. A single bottle has lasted me 2 years of daily use! It still has a bit left and I'll be buying another bottle once I use up some of my other (long neglected) oils.  I actually really like the light natural scent and the beautiful blue colour. Since the bottle is clear, remember to keep out of sunlight! I store mine in a bathroom cabinet to prevent the product from turning.

This oil has dramatically made a difference in my skin. I got a sample a few days ago and my acne scars have diminished quite a bit, I have a radiant glow, and although I still get a few breakouts (ugh, hormonal acne) they go away a lot more quickly with this. The first night I tried it, I had a few small white heads on my cheeks. I woke up the next morning and it was if the oil had purged them and they seemed bigger. I was hesitant about using it again, but the second night I put the oil on and The next day, they were gone. I love the smell and feel of this oil. The only other one I have tried that is just as wonderful is the Korres Viramin C oil. This was truly made for those who suffer from breakouts. My advice is: Give it time to work. I am definitely buying the full size!

reviews.review_title: Amazing - cleared away all acne scars
reviews.review_text: So I had persistent adult acne for a while - then I stopped using one product and switched to Lapis as my daytime serum/treatment oil and it's been absolutely amazing!! Not only did my acne go away but so did all these blemishes and scars! My skin looks so much smoother and happier and the texture has improved so much. I tend to switch products a lot (curiosity!) but I think this one's a keeper.
I love to use natural products, but I also want to get rid of acne and this under my serum at night or under makeup in the day is amazing! Subtle nice smell and easy to apply!

I am so impressed with this product! T is part of my nightly routine. 4-5 drops and pat it in to my face and jaw line. I'm not crazy about the smell, but i am fine with it if it continues to produce these results! The texture of my skin has smoothed out and has calmed inflammation. O have noticed a big difference in the overall tone of my face and spots have lightened. I love this facial oil and will buy again!!

As a person who has experienced breakouts from a lot of oil-based products I was very skeptical about trying this oil on my skin. However, I was pleasantly surprised when I discovered that this oil brought moisture and life back into my skin without causing breakouts.     It sinks into the skin after a minute or two of applying and does not feel heavy. As an added bonus, I notice a positive difference in my makeup application when I use this product beforehand.

I was hesitant to purchase this without trying it because my skin is combo, has some redness/acne scarring along the cheek and jaw line, and the only other oil I've used (Kiehl's midnight recovery, which is touted to be a holy grail product for that line) didn't really wow me.  Enter Herbivore line.  I got the blue tansy mask on a whim and was completely in love. I love the ingredients, the way it made my skin feel, the visible change I saw almost instantly. It felt too good to be true. So I bit the bullet and invested in Lapis.  It's a gorgeous oil. It absorbs well, smells heavenly, and has done some magic on my skin already. I don't feel so terrified being out without makeup anymore. The scars have visibly reduced. I can't wait to see what a year of using this blue tansy combo of mask and oil will do.  Invest in your skin, you're absolutely worth every penny. It is life changing when you feel confident in your own skin!!!

Love Lapis... You guys, look at the ingredient list! It's so hard to find luxury products that are CLEAN and feel like a treat for your skin. Plus, this works..   Keeping it all in perspective, this item is a luxury item to top off a beauty routine. It is light, smells pleasant (I don't agree that this smells bad, as others say... it smells natural and not laced with chemicals), and it is gorgeously packaged.   I apply this at the end of my skin routine after washing, toning, hydrosol and serum.. then pat and press 4-5 drops into the skin. It leaves my skin glowy and fresh, and has a mild drying effect on red or inflamed areas.  Do your research and look up the effects of Blue Tansy on skin.. it does those things, and this product is awesome. Thank you Herbivore for offering a natural line that is beautiful and works, among so much chemical gunk! <3

let me just say I absolutely hate the smell of this. I've used other blue tansy products so I'm not sure what it is but this to me smells straight up like Jack Daniels. not sure why or how and I'm sure I'm the only one but it does. having a horrible college experience with Jack Daniels, I wasn't able to use this oil for a long period of time since the smell makes me nauseous. BUT! this is the ultimate skin irritation savior. it is amazing for any kind of acne and it does absorb into the skin with some time. I had used a mask that started making me break out immediately after I rinsed it off. I decided to apply this heavily to my face and massage it into the affected area. after about a couple hours the irritation and bumps were 70% gone and by morning they were completely gone without a trace. I will be keeping this in my arsenal without a second thought. if you have any kind of acne or easily irritated skin, this is a must!
Honestly beautiful. Nothing makes my skin glow quite like this oil. It has made my skin look better without foundation. However, It doesn't wear quite as well with heavy foundation.

Love this oil!!! Was looking for a replacement for UFO, as I'm trying to not use salicylic acid. Lapis smells amazing, is hydrating and my skin is smoother after a few days of use in combination with Biossance's vitamin C rose oil.

I got a little tiny sample from my mom which she got in her ipsy and I ran out I only used it for 5 days and it cleared my skin tremendously I'm a teen and I have teen acne and it worked wonders I hope to try more in the future.

I noticed a difference in acne scaring, texture, hydration, and discoloration. This never caused any break outs. I have had my bottle for 6 months and I still have more than half left. It was DEFINITELY worth the money for me.

I know this product doesn't work for everyone - so start with the smaller roller option, or grab a sample if you can.  Having said that, this facial oil was a great investment for my skin. At the time I was dealing with a really oily t-zone and a painfully dry and flakey patch on my cheeks; as well as healing from some derm-treatments on my deep and angry cystic acne. It helped soothe the dry patches without oiling up every other part of my face. It reduced the redness and inflammation from my cystic acne along the jawline.   I've been using it consistently day-night for 2 months, barely made a dent in the bottle, and have seen overall, less irritation and redness during breakouts, no more flakey angry skin, and it helped plump up some of the faintest fine lines near my mouth that I attribute to skin dehydration.  However, unlike the directions I do apply SPF moisturizer after I've let it sink in, in the AM and a heavier night cream in the PM.

A review will not do Lapis, or Herbivore in general, justice. I am in love with this company. Do yourself a favor and dump all of your existing skincare and get a cleansing bar and oil from Herb now. Give it a full 2 weeks with no other skincare and see the results. Just do it!!! And thank you Herbivore. You guys have a loyal customer for life!
Got a sample and it definitely helps with acne I always get breakouts on my chin and this oil really helped reduce them over night. Will continue to use and will buy for sure!!

reviews.review_title: My first review EVER so you know the love is real
reviews.review_text: REFER TO THE TITLE. I swear this has changed my life. I was the person who had a 12 step skincare routine trying to cure persistent acne, hyper pigmentation, and also get that glow that people with perfect skin have. I have the kind of skin that doesn't really break out from products but just nothing changes...ever. I've tried everythingggg from the drugstore and switched to expensive Sephora skincare and still no acne changes. Bought this 3 months ago (wanted to make sure it was actually this product before I go raving) and guys...I HAVE NOT HAD ONE CYSTIC ACNE SINCE. I do get one pimple the week before my period but I just dab a little extra on it and it's smaller the next morning. It has actually helped speed up my breakouts! I went from 12 steps to just my Lush Herbalism face wash (I only use at night though), my toner I make myself (witch hazel, tea tree oil, lavender oil), Kiehls midnight recover eye cream, and this oil. I'm now that person that people compliment how glowy their skin is which I never ever thought would happen. Haven't worn foundation since and the last time my face was this clear was before puberty. This has tremendously helped balance my skin and increase pigmentation turnover. I use this day (3 drops) and night (5-6 drops) and it soaks in just fine. I've actually changed my skin type from extremely oily to normal. Like what are you serious. I was nervous for the added coconut oil but I'm glad I decided to push through the scare. Please try!

I experience minor breakouts around the time of my periods, and I find that I can avoid most of the breakouts if I use this before and after my periods. I have had this oil for several months now, and it really seems to work. The smell can be a bit offensive, but you only need to use about 3 drops.   More recentl yI have been using this on a nightly basis, and I find that it makes my skin smoother overall.

I didn't notice any results with this oil. It seemed to just sit on the surface of my face rather than sinking in, even when used in combination with products designed to improve skin care absorption.   But it does smell nice and look pretty sitting on a vanity. It also didn't cause any breakouts.

I personally have normal/combination skin and when I use a product that irritates my skin I get red little bumps on my forehead, particularly above the nose and between the eyebrows area and sometimes around my cheeks. I've been using the blue tansy resurfacing mask a couple times a week (3x max) for a few weeks now and I've seen a major improvement - my redness and bumps have gone down! I always use the Blue Lapis facial oil afterwards too instead of basic, chemical-filled moisturizers and I'm super satisfied. It's expensive but definitely long-lasting and worth it. You only need a couple drops here and there (depending on how dry your skin is). Now that I've tried this facial oil I will never go back to moisturizers.
I suffer from eczema and acne. This product saved me! my skin hasn't looked this good in quite some time. I'm hooked

This oil saved my skin! I have fair combo blemish prone skin since moving to a more humid climate and this instantly reduced the size of very big annoying pimples even my prescription gel wasn't getting rid of! It instantly made my skin feel and look better! I highly recommend this since I've tried almost every product at Sephora with no success!

Most of my life I have struggled with balancing my skin. I have combination skin. My t-zone is usually very oily and my cheeks are a bit dry. I have fair skin as well, meaning my skin is very sensitive. The calming benefits of this product really make this worth purchasing. My redness is less noticeable and I am less oily and more balanced. Absolutely in love!

I can't live without this. It's change my skin from being red and dry in places and super oily in the T zone to being mostly neutral all over. I constantly get compliments on my skin and my makeup! I bought this in November and now it's the end of May, I use it every day, and a little goes a long way, so definitely a good buy. I can't recommend this more!

I got this from a friend who it didn't work from and I am definitely going to repurchase once I finish this bottle. While my friend and I both have oily skin, my skin is oily because of a lack of moisture and hers is just oily. I think that this difference is why this works amazingly for some people and fails terribly for others. In my case all the claims of the oil are true.

I have a combination skin with a very oily T-Zone, and after reading so many good reviews on this product I decided to give it a try to see if I could get a more balanced skin. But, unfortunately, this was the worse product I've ever purchased.  I was really bumped down because I really wanted to love it. But it didn't. It made my skin produce way more oil and as a result I experienced horrible breakouts. I do, however, love the earthy smell that it has!   In the end, I had to return it.

Sounds counter-intuitive but this oil somehow need us the oiliness of my t-zone! It also clears out my blemish and reduced my very visible pores. It smells very earthy and light. Will definitely purchase again!

I love this and the ORCHID oil from Herbivore.  After I use the pineapple mask, i smooth a few drops of the Lapis oil and my skin glows with clarity.  Great mixture of oils that actually unclogs my pores and keeps my skin looking 10 years younger than my age.

reviews.review_title: By far, one of the BEST products i've ever tried
reviews.review_text: My skin type: -combination (oily t zone, very dry cheeks) -dryer in winter, oilier in summer -very acne prone (used to have severe cystic acne), easily congested - redness and sensitivity to SOME ingredients  I have tried MANY skincare products. I have finally been able to take control of my skin with the help of several products and a clarisonic.  I came across this product by chance and decided I'd try it since it said it was ideal for combination skin types. I was shocked at how well it worked within the first couple of weeks. I had always been skeptical of all natural products because I always had this weird theory that products with chemicals and preservatives would be more advanced and more effective. I was so wrong in this case.   Within the first week, my skin wasn't producing nearly as much oil as it usually had, any inflammation and redness in my skin disappeared everytime I applied this, and whenever I had a bout of hives on my face I would apply a healthy dose of this oil and pat it in my skin. It would came my hives right down. I use it during the day mixed in with my moisturizer so it doesn't make my foundation look greasy and I get a nice layer on at night as my last step of my routine.   My boyfriend has extremely sensitive and acne prone skin. He is using a retinoid cream to get rid of it that is causing extreme irritation, redness and flakiness in his skin. He uses this oil everyday and his skin is immediately calmer and his redness is reduced. This is one of the best products I have ever use and I hope it works for others too.

I'm new to facial oils but I find that less is always more and you need to press this in rather than rub. I like how this keeps my oily skin balanced all day.   During the day I like to finish my skincare by tapping in 2 drops all over my face. It keeps me hydrated and gives my skin a great glow that actually controls my oil.   At night I like to lay it on a little heavier and really press it into the skin after moonfruit.   It's a great oil but if you have a coconut oil sensitivity stay away
I highly recommend this product to anyone. Amazing!!!

I have very acne prone skin and for years have been trying to get it under control till I stumbled along this! It has cleared my acne and dark spots from acne scaring and I couldn't be anymore happy. I could cry cause this stuff has been a life saver!! I wish I knew about this 10 years ago! I will continue to buy this.

Initiallt, I thought this was working well, but then I noticed when it would heal a zit, two or three more big ones would pop up in its place. I gave it a chance, but after a couple weeks my skin looked absolutely awful. I noticed a bit too late that this contains coconut oil, which is a disaster on my skin. If your skin can handle coconut oil, I imagine this would work great. It smells nice and absorbs we'll, but if your skin can't handle coconut oil, I would try something else.

Really wanted to love this for my oily, acne-genic skin, but after using the entire bottle I don't seem to notice a big difference. I find that it doesn't absorb that great into my skin, though it does hydrate to some extent. It also didn't do anything for my redness, both immediately after application and 20 minutes later. On the plus side, it does last a long time for those who actually do notice any benefits!

I loved every single claim in this product and it would have been so effective... without the coconut oil. At first, I saw amazing results with this. The acne that I had began to clear and dry up without drying up my skin.. However, as time went on, I noticed that my pores became clogged. I had to stop using it.

This oil does wonders for my skin. I have dry/normal acne prone skin and within 2 weeks my blemishes faded and I don't break out nearly as bad as I used to. I feel like my face has a glow to it as well! Would highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: Wanted To Love, But Broke Me Out Badly
reviews.review_text: I love Herbivore as a company, and their packaging is gorgeous. Unfortunately, this facial oil broke me out badly. I suffer from hormonal acne along my jaw line, and had read rave reviews about this stuff, so I thought I would give it a shot. It appears my skin seems to be ultra sensitive to anything with coconut oil in it (such as this product). I broke out all over my face after using this for a couple weeks and had to make an appointment with a cosmetic dermatologist to help get cleared up. It could work great for other people, but my skin seems to do far better with argan or jojoba oils. Two stars for packaging and company ideals!

This stuff is so fun! I love the bottle, the dropper, the color, & smell!  A little definitely goes a long way!! This has helped SO much with my winter skin woes! My skin is sensitive, oily, acne, & pores. And yet the oil doesn't make any of it worse!   I love to use this after an at home spa day of exfoliating and masks. It goes on so well and brings results!

This Lapis oil smells nice, and does a very good job of hydrating without feeling greasy.  It also seems to deliver on the claim of reducing redness, but I can't quite tell if it's this oil or something else - the perils of simultaneously doing a nutrition overhaul I guess.  I am at least very glad that I have not had any clogged pores as a result of using this oil.
Didn't break me out which is fine but not really hydrating for this combo/oily/dry patches from tretinoin skin. Using it up on my neck and chest.

I am not huge on writing review but lately I've been relying on them more and more for new products so I thought I had to return the favour to other beauties. I love this product! Lapis is really gentle for those of us with super sensitive skin. I is also very nourishing for dry areas and not heavy on oily ones for those with combination skin. I found my skin is changing as I am growing older and with the seasons and Herbivore's Lapis oil keeps up with all my skins needs while making it calmer, less red, and incredibly soft. You can also layer it under a moisturizer of sunscreen without feeling like your face is covered in products.

This is a holy grail product for me! My skin has improved dramatically since I've used this. It really helps my acne prone, sensitive, combination skin. I like it better then the Sunday Riley Luna oil.

reviews.review_title: I can't believe how good this is
reviews.review_text: Well anytime a natural brand or product gets popular I have to check it out - and this was definitely on my list. I found it on the site and read all about it, then a short while later found myself in store buying this and the Tansy mask. Well ladies, this is the oil for you. I am a natural redhead who's got the typical thin skin which is prone to redness and I am SO happy for what this has done. I am always on the search for products which can help me switch to not needing much make up and I truly think this has helped. My skin has absolutely improved (probably with the help of that magical Tansy stuff) but I would not doubt the power in this little bottle. I was using Belif before (still use the problem solution cleanser) and if I had some sugary food or dairy I would break out the next day, and I thought to myself well that means I'm not using the right stuff still. Somehow this has changed things! My skin has cleared up no matter what I eat! Please give this a try and see what you think. I can't tell how long it'll last but no matter what I'll just rebuy it. Yes there's a scent to it but I'll tolerate it. Herbivore keep making new products!!

I have combination skin with breakouts on my chin every so often. Started using a smal bit of this oil on my chin area morning and night after cleansing. It's incredible the change I've seen! I still have some small congestion but seriously haven't had a single blemish in the 4 months since I started using it. Just opening my second bottle and I'm never going back!

This broke me out... not purging broke me out either but the coconut oil in it clogged my pores. Some people swear by coconut oil but it doesn't work for me. It's a very comedonegic oil and even though it works for some, me if didn't. Sorry Lapis, back you went. I do recommend the aloe after sun spray from them though, it's fab!

This oil is incredible. I have very sensitive acne prone skin and this oil has changed my face for the better. I no longer wake up with a new blemish every morning, I use morning and night after washing my face and its amazing.

I like this oil. I have combination skin and I think it has improved. It's not drastic, but there is less flaking on my nose and my cheeks are less inflamed. I feel like the oil is contesting my t zone a little though. My bf likes the scent a lot, smells like fresh tea!

I never would have believed that an OIL would eliminate my acne but this stuff does. .  I have tried so many moisturizing products over the years but every single one has either not helped or made my acne worse.   I of course have also tried all kinds of acne-eliminating products but benzoyl peroxide and salicylic acid, while they do work, are not something i can wear all day and night all the time. The products make make-up application more difficult and sometimes have permanently stained clothing.   I can't say I'm completely acne-free. I still have some issues with blackheads on my nose, but I haven't had a single pimple on my face since I started using this product. I occasionally get a pimple on my neck and when I dab this stuff on it it is gone the next day.  So. All that is to say if you have had a similar experience I highly recommend trying this. It is the first product in my life which has removed acne that I am completely happy with.  Also, if you don't want to commit to this giant (expensive) bottle, they do make a rollerball version. That's what I started with.  :)

I was skeptical to spend money on this because I've tried every type of oil controlling, mattifying makeup and skincare out there but after a week of this I'm hooked and know I'll keep repurchasing. My face is usually slick by mid-day but with this my skin isn't oily and it balances out my redness and has helped with breakouts. I use it daily in the mornings after I wash my face and let it absorb in before I put on makeup.

I wanted so badly to love this oil after reading all the positive reviews, but I just don't. It smells good, so that's a plus. However, I find it takes a lot of rubbing and smearing to get it to absorb into my skin and even then, my skin still looks oily. I have experimented with how much oil to use and it makes no difference if I use a lot or a little. Sometimes if I don't spend the required 10 mins rubbing it in, it will leave a blue residue on my face! I have started using it on my body just to get rid of it. I will not be repurchasing this oil.

This will not banish your redness alone, but it calms and moisturizes my skin perfectly. I'm a huge fan of the consistency and the top ingredients that Herbivore uses in their oils. The smell is slightly herbally and not my favorite but I prefer that over an added fragrance.   The instructions say to use 5-6 drops and that is wayyyyy too much. I use 2 drops max and my skin is more than moisturized throughout the night. I use an eye cream and aha/bha serum before this step and I have not had any issues.

I'd been using Sunday Riley Luna oil for a few months and decided to try this instead. It hasn't changed my life or anything, but I like it. I have an oily T-zone and dry cheeks and Lapis does help balance those out. I haven't noticed any change in redness or pore size, though. It doesn't smell great - there's a slight herbal/floral note to it, but it mostly smells like vitamins. The other two Herbivore oils smell much nicer and I look forward to trying those as well.
Worth every penny. My dry red t-zone stared to disappeared after a week. I use the oil on my face, elbows, knees and tattoos. My husband also uses it.

Once you get past the slightly funky smell and the price point, you will not be able to go back from this. The consistency of this oil is not too heavy, and not too light. It does a great job at calming my skin (I have a lot of redness due to retinol medication I am using) and providing just the right amount of moisture with no greasy residue. That and the fact that the ingredients are 100% natural, I am a fan. My only recommendation for Sephora would be to carry the smaller rollerball version of this; I had to look on other websites for it because I wanted to try it first before going in for this splurge.

I cannot get over how amazing this product is! I've been using it on my oily, acne-prone skin for about a week and the difference is staggering.  I've even had a bad head cold/flu for the past three days but my skin has still never looked better.  My one complaint is I am not a huge fan of the smell, but it's something I can certainly deal with to have beautiful skin!
This oil is amazing. I have combo/oily acne skin and this has helped more than any other product or prescription. It does what it says and balances the skin. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: amazing face oil for dry acne prone skin
reviews.review_text: I have never tried a face oil that is so light and can absorb so fast into my skin ( i tried almost every face oil out there: josie maran argan oil regular/light, tarte oil, drunk elephant oil, fresh seaberry, etc.; some of these oils are greasy and some broke me out) After 2 weeks of using this product, my dry skin becomes normal and acnes disappearing. If your skin's oil production is unbalanced, this will be your holygrail!

I have been using this facial oil for less than a week but I am already seeing phenomenal results. It is probably one of the few products I have EVER used that actually does what it says it will do. I have used many oils in the past that have completely let me down so I was a little apprehensive to try it. This oil soaks into my skin quickly, has balanced my completely oily, acne prone, peeling nightmare of a face and reduced redness. I bought this with little hope of it changing anything but it quickly became the best thing I have ever done for my skin. I use this along with Herbivore's charcoal soap. Amazing products!!!

I am so glad I sucked it up and bought this oil. Lapis delivers on every promise and then some. I've got oily, acne-prone skin, and in the month I've been using this, my skin has become brighter and less oily, it feels more hydrated, and I've had significantly fewer breakouts. Just flat-out the best.

I know skincare takes a long time to see results. But this facial oil changed my skin overnight. I had some small breakouts and rough spots in my skin and I applied this overnight and woke up to diminished pimples and smooth skin. It also is amazing for my oily skin. I cannot put this down now.

Love the packaging and scent of the product! A little goes a long way! Has an earthy fresh scent to it. Had really improved my over all skin tone! Great for combo/oily skin! Very hydrating, yet effective to reduce oiling and improved the appearance of redness ! Will repurchase!

This has really helped diminish the size of the pores on and around my nose. It balances the oily parts of my face while moisturizing the flaky/dry parts leaving my skin evenly toned and moisturized. Smells lovely, like light floral and not overpowering and sinks in quickly. Works great under makeup as well. Would definitely recommend for those with combination skin!

I've been using this product for the last two weeks, and I'm impressed. My skin is overall better than when I was using another face oil. My face feels well moisturized, and my natural oil production and redness has decreased. The smell is amazing, and a few drops goes a long way.

At first I did not like this oil. It didn't make my skin worse, but I didn't see any immediate improvement either when i used in in the summer. After a couple months on the shelf, I gave it another try since the weather was getting cold and dry, and my skin needed more than my usual moisturizer. My skin is nourished and softer than ever, and my blemishes are minimal. Truly a miracle product for winter!

Ive been using this for a few months and can't believe the difference it has made.  I still have the occasional breakout but overall the texture and glow of my skin has dramatically improved.  I noticed results in a few weeks and started getting comments on how good my skin looked.  I use it morning and night with no other moisturizer.  I agree that the scent is a little strong but I've gotten used to it and it doesn't linger.

I wanted to like this very much but to be honest it made my skin WORSE. I have tried oils in the past and some of them break me out and then some only do for a couple days then I'm good but this. This is nothing like I've had before. I had terrible breakouts and they were ones that hurt too! I tried everything with this from only putting it on itself to putting it on top of my moisturizer and nothing worked and I know it was not my moisturizer because I have used it for a lot of years. So I thought maybe it was only for a little bit that this would happen so I used it for almost a month and I couldn't take it anymore my face looked terrible and this did nothing to help it. I was so happy to return it because now that I'm off of it, my face is back to normal and not as an oil slick like it was when I used it. So if you are prone to acne I would watch out, even though it says it is for acne be careful!
I've tried many different things over the years (94 my

I tried this product as a possible alternative to the higher price pointed Sunday Riley Luna Oil- similar active ingredients (inc. blue tansy) but seems a bit more pure. Very happy with the results. Just as effective as the Luna- skin is clearer and brighter. Excellent for balancing oil but won't dry you out. Will definitely be purchasing again.

This oil absorbs quickly & leaves my skin soft & smooth. Like others, I find it heals blemishes and helps even out my complexion. I like it so much I just ordered the Orchid oil for daytime use. The only thing I dislike is the scent- it smells like old potpourri to me. Kind of a combo of cedar, roses & dried mint. Fortunately the scent fades very quickly & isn't bad enough to stop me from using this fabulous oil.

I've written maybe one review before. I hardly ever feel like anything is great enough to put in that kind of effort, even if I love it. THIS needs to be shared though. I'm 31, I've had acne since I was a teenager. My skin cleared up drastically in my early 20s but it's been horrible ever since I had babies and my hormones went nuts. I've tried everything. Any three step skin care regimen I could find, from expensive subscriptions to more affordable drug store products, oral and topical prescriptions, you name it. This oil helped my skin more in ONE NIGHT than years and years of all that other stuff. So while I can't give a FULL review because it has only been one night, I can tell you with certainty even the change I saw in one day was worth the cost! Just try it. Seriously.
Best skin oil ever!!! Perfect for sensitive acne prone skin. Lighter than Luna.

I am committed to natural skincare and have tried the diy route, lower cost options, and some higher cost options. I have oily, sensitive skin that I've discovered prefers facial oils over many other moisturizers. In the past I've tried vintner's daughter and kypris 1000 roses, and I've found that Lapis rivals them both. My skin loves this oil, though I do use it only at night. I've noticed a more even tone and calmer skin since I've used it. This oil smells great (though quite herbal) and feels silly and luxurious when you apply.

This is one of the most amazing products I have ever used. Using this in conjunction with the blue tansy mask has cleared up my skin and my scarring is fading dramatically. I'm not sure about the oil balancing qualities yet, because I still get oily throughout the day, however I feel as though it has decreased slightly.

I tend to break out quite often-mostly around my chin & nose. As an almost 30 year old, it is super frustrating! I've tried a ton of products on my skin and have never found anything that I didn't feel broke me out and actually helped my skin until this product. It is perfect. I have been using it for about a month now and my skin has never looked better! It is smooth everywhere and has such a nice glow now. I highly recommend if you have combination/oily skin.

after stopping the pill, my skin started breaking out / acting unpredictable. this facial oil has saved my skin from breakouts going beyond blemishes (which is awesome because my skin scars from acne). I highly recommend using this product in conjunction with another product to help even out skin--not only does this moisturize but it doesn't make my skin greasy / inflamed.

reviews.review_title: Excellent oil for acne-prone sensitive skin
reviews.review_text: It saved my skin when it was at its absolute worse - dehydrated and extremely sensitive from benzoyl peroxide and prescription retinoid.. It calmed and hydrated my skin. it does not clog my pores (and almost everything does), and I think it actually helps clear the breakouts, though I'm not sure how it does it.... I highly recommend it!

From reading reviews i thought i would give this item a shot. I have combo skin of normal/oily and boy did this product do justice for my acne & oiliness. I don't have much acne just on my chin but it went down instantly after a couple days using it night only and it really does control oil on the t-zone. I highly recommend this product and it is defiantly worth the investment a little goes a long way.

reviews.review_title: New Staple to my Skin Care Regimen
reviews.review_text: For starters, I have extremely fair, extremely oily, and extremely acne-prone skin. I've been fighting my acne for about 10 years now. I've gone to the dermatologist. I've tried every pre-boxed regimen offered. All have not given me much in the way of results. Due to my complexion, my acne has also given some pretty dark hyper-pigmentation. I finally decided to try Herbivore brand products. I am currently using this in the morning with Herbivore's charcoal soap. I also use their Moonfruit Treatment as my evening  moisturizer. I've been using this regimen for about 2 weeks and I cannot believe the difference in my skin. I have no new acne. My active acne is going away. My overall skin texture is completely changed. My skin is smooth and soft; my rough texture has completely disappeared. My redness has gone down and my hyper-pigmentation seems to be fading. This is more than I have ever wanted to spend on skin care, but I will gladly spend this over and over again if I keep getting these results. I'm absolutely amazed!

I just received this a few days ago and it is probably the best oil I've used during my morning routine. I have very oily skin and my makeup is usually a hot mess before lunch, but today it stayed right in place (except for a few spots around my nose). I did not notice a change in my acne or scars yet, but it's still a winner for keeping mega amounts of oil off of my face and helping it look healthy.
Now I don't usually write reviews unless I think it's worth for my time to write one.   This baby made my ance disappear OVERNIGHT!!!! Hello to FLAWLESS!!!!!
Great hydration! Perfect for combination skin. Hydrates dry areas while balancing my oily t-zone

reviews.review_title: The perfect oil for Combo Skin
reviews.review_text: My past experience with moisturizers/oils usually leaves me hydrated but breaking out/oily or not breaking out but with dry patches.  More often than not I settle for latter, and was expecting a similar experience with Lapis but I was wrong.  Lapis healed the blemishes I had and within a week, no new ones were forming.  My skin is now clear, hydrated, soft, and best of all I rarely use makeup anymore because my skin looks amazing.  Cannot recommend enough. (For reference, I use Drunk Elephant's JuJu Bar to cleanse, organic witch hazel as my toner followed by Lapis)

Although this oil is a bit too much on the pricey side for me I am very wowed by its use. I have combination skin and I do have redness usually after cleansing my face; whatever this oil is made up of took away my redness almost instantly and my face looks refreshing. More than it usually looks. By the way, whatever the ingredients is inside this oil smells exactly like when you walk into a Teavana store. Like minty tea with floral notes. Smells very good!

I have dry combo skin and have been using this oil at night for a week. I noticed my acne scars have started to lighten and there's less redness in my face. My face also feels so hydrated. I was using Sunday rileys Luna oil and thought I might cheat temporalily with Herbivoce but honestly this oil exceeded my expectations so much! This one is a keeper!!

I can see this working really well for people with drier skin, who are looking for a thick moisturizer with their oil. I love oils, but this one felt almost sticky-thick. After only a few days I could see a visible difference in my skin tone (more even and glowing). Not for me but could be exactly what someone else is looking for.

I never ever write reviews but this is AWESOME! I have super oily skin with ridiculously massive pores. I've tried everything to no avail. I'm also the type that definitely prefers the 'less is more' approach to skin care. The easier the better, and this has become the only product I use regularly (replacing moisturizer, under eye moisturizer, and toner) and my skin has never looked better. It's still oily but with a healthy glow and the shine doesn't show for several hours after using this. 5-6 drops is enough for the whole face, so don't let the price tag scare you. I'm barely halfway through the bottle and it's been 4 months. Highly recommend if you're looking for a simple approach to skin care.
I have pretty normal skin with a touch of dryness under my nose and this oil has made all the difference. I'm super happy with how my skin looks now!

I really wanted to like this one from all the positive reviews, I did notice a slight reduction in redness in y cheeks. But after about a week I noticed more and more clogged pores and small pimples. I thought my skin was purging so I kept on for a month. Now I wish I hadn't been so stubborn headed, my face has small breakouts  all over. I haven't seen my skin look like this in over a decade. This oil was the only thing I changed in my routine.

I recently heard of the hype for Herbivore products and as an esthetician I needed to try them out! I have oily-combination skin and am a lover of facial oils and this is such a beautiful oil. The smell has me smiling while I apply it, a little goes a long way and the packaging is just a bonus. My skin feels hydrated, glowing and clear and I can't get over the smell it's a dream!
This oil reminds me of Sunday Riley Luna oil. But I notice this one absorbs quickly too. You only need a couple of drops for your whole face.

Wow! I started using the travel size roller ball back in the beginning of June ( almost out now ). Already I have seen a huge difference in my skin and any little blemishes I've had have gone away. Now I don't have acne but I do get those pesky time of the month breakouts or whenever I try a new foundations or primer from time to time, however I do tend to be red. This oil heals and soothes my skin and aids in controlling my blemishes. I just purchase the full size, lately I either use it over top of a moisturizer for added hydration or simply alone and let it absorb in before applying makeup... Either way AMAZING results. Herbivore definitely made a happy customer out of me!

Ok, so it does have a funky smell for me, BUT in only 3 days my skin has started clearing up. I don't have acne but I do have, you know, those horrible, pesky, that time of the month, can't seem to shake them, spots. I've been so frustrated every month it's the same thing and they like to hang around. I used to swear by DE products and bought both of there serums and oil thinking it would help, and it did, a little bit. Within three days of using this, the blue tansy face mask, and estee lauders micro essence, I will never be without these products again. I know you really start to see results 2 weeks after starting a new product so I can't wait to see those results if I'm already that impressed!

I am an oil queen. I have everything and love almost every smell out there. For reference I have the UFO oil from Sunday Riley. I love the smell but the results are just meh for me. So I wanted to try this and my goodness it is gross no think I got a nasty one. It is not blue and does not smell at all like blue tansy. It was a milky green colour. And it smelt like sweat. I didn't even get to try it because I wouldn't dare put it on my face. Maybe I will order the herbivore roller ball and hopefully it would arrive blue. Quality control much? I think not. Returned.

So, before anything, I will HANDS DOWN recommend this oil over any of Sunday Riley's because 1) It's smell is MUCH less intense and only lasts for 5ish minutes before it completely disappears. (I've tried Artemis and UFO and BOTH have really really strong smells that lingers for hours, even on my pillow) 2) It's much lighter than any of SR's as well. The SR oils are all very viscose and when I tried this one I realized how much easier it was to massage into my skin.   I know UFO is marketed as a 'dry oil' but to me it's not; THIS is a dry oil. It's not greasy feeling, it's hydrating, it sinks in swiftly and I wake up with incredible smooth skin and small pores. Love it.

I actually ordered this in a roller ball from Herbivore's website, but I plan to purchase from Sephora when that runs out.  That being said, I love love love this oil. I have dry, acne prone skin (I can't win), and this oil has been great - I actually like it better than Sunday Riley's UFO that I got as a sample.  The oil doesn't break me out and has been helping keep my skin from drying out. I use the oil twice a day, morning and evening. I really like this under my moisturizer in the morning, and actually really liked it under my makeup.  I actually used this oil, then forgot to use my regular moisturizer and wound up putting foundation right over the oil - no marked difference in how my foundation (Diorskin Forever) sat on my skin or blended in.  Overall I'm really impressed with this oil and I will definitely be repurchasing as well as trying the other oils from Herbivore.

bought the roller ball from their website and I love it! I use it in the morning and it gives just the right amount of moisture and definitely lives up to its claim of being oil balancing. Have noticed some of my dark spots fading as well.

To date, this is the only moisturizer I have ever tried that hasn't left my skin feeling/looking oily midday. I was super hesitant to buy this product due to the hefty price tag, but I'm soooo glad I did. You only need a small amount of the oil, so it'll last forever! I've been using it morning and night for two months now and have barely made a dent in it. Since discovering Herbivore, my skin has cleared up tremendously. In addition to the lapsis oil, I also use their blue tansy mask and pink clay bar soap. This brand is seriously a god send.

I suffer from hormonal cystic acne. This is the only product that has made a noticeable, material difference. I still get minor acne throughout a given month, but for the past ~3 months of using this product morning and night, my monthly cystic acne has been a no-show. Cannot praise this enough, as I thought no product could help with cystic acne. I now want to try more blue tansy products - the mask is next on my list!

I'm in my mid-20s with chronic acne due to stress and hormonal imbalances. My skin looks pretty good these days because of Retin-A but still have problems with oil control. I also get smaller bumps when I'm stressed, and need a good moisturizer. Usually I use a DIY oil moisturizer-- grapeseed and tamanu. I love using oil for oily skin because it does a great job rehydrating and leaves your skin glow-y. Retin-A also leaves your skin a bit red, as if you have a slight chemical burn, and oil feels very soothing.  I've always wanted to try it but the large bottle at Sephora is expensive. I found a smaller version in a perfume rollerball style bottle at a local store for $30.  I LOVE this stuff. It clarifies your skin, gives you a glow, is light yet hydrating, and soothes inflammation. Usually my face is oily by mid-day and definitely after I've slept the whole night but this does a fantastic job at oil control too.

reviews.review_title: wish i knew about it sooner!
reviews.review_text: I've used this oil for about 2 weeks, and the change is amazing. I had little breakouts that never seemed to go away, and a SUPER oily t-zone by mid day. I was skeptical about putting oil on my already oily skin, but it makes sense, my skin was producing more oil to compensate for the oil I had been stripping off for years. I'm early 30s and struggle with break outs. I used it the first night, and the next morning my skin looked almost clear and skin tone was amazing. Each day it gets even more flawless. I'm 2 weeks in and My skin looks amazing even with out make up which is crazy. (I haven't gone with out it yet, but definitely could) By mid day, the oil in my t-zone is minimal and I really don't need to touch up my make up.  Tip: I use the 10 drops at night, then I only use about 5-6 drops in the mornings. I also tie my hair back until the product had pretty much soaked in. It was making my hair greasy and I would break out where my hair touched my forehead if I went to sleep right after application. Waiting about 10-15 min with my hair pulled back seemed to do the trick and no more breakouts along the hairline.

I've been living with spotty skin for most of my adult life, but since starting to wean my second kid (after a solid 4 years of being pregnant, breastfeeding or both!) my hormones are haywire and they are cruelly and viciously taking it out on my poor face. I've been on a six month quest to fix the issue, and this oil has made the biggest difference.  In terms of use, it's pleasant enough. The earthy (read: slightly funky) smell has grown on me. I use about 5 drips off the dropper for my big face. It takes a minute of massaging to absorb 90% of it, and the rest absorbs completely within half an hour. It sits well under make up and doesn't affect any product I put on after.  The other reviews are all accurate. I've been using this for 2 weeks and my skin looks better than it has in years. No new blemishes, closed comedones have vanished or are shrinking, old spots are healing and even months-old post inflammatory hyper pigmentation spots are already fading.   My previously shiny t-zone is now just glowy. In just two weeks I've gone from using a full coverage matte foundation to a sheer BB cream.   I am so happy I could cry.

Wow. I've been using it for about 2 weeks, as well as the Blue Tansy mask (also from Herbivore), and the two products together have completely changed my skin. My existing breakouts have cleared up, I haven't had a new blemish pop up since I started using them, and some of the hyper pigmentation from past breakouts has even started fading. The Lapis oil is pricey, but worth every penny. This will be a permanent part of my skincare routine.

reviews.review_title: This oil has changed my life!
reviews.review_text: I've always had very oily and acne prone combination skin.  Everything settles into my pores.  Everything!  And oils?  Forget it!  But after all the positive reviews I decided to try this just in case it would work for me.  I've been using it for a week now, morning and night, and WOW!  My skin looks smoother, my pores appear smaller and my blackheads are diminishing.  Also my sun spots are fading!  This stuff is a miracle for me.

would still highly recommend for people who can tolerate coconut oil in their skincare products. I used the Lapis oil for about 3 months. I have stubborn hormonal acne on my chin and after reviewing my skincare routine, my dermatologist suggested the coconut oil in this product could be making my acne worse. I was heartbroken because this oil is fantastic for calming irritated skin and shrunk existing spots and faded acne scars almost overnight. However, I did notice that little bumps would pop up on parts of my face where I don't normally get acne (i.e. forehead, cheeks) while I was using this oil. In conclusion, I'm taking off a star because I think it's a bit odd to have coconut oil in a product for acne-prone skin, but I would still recommend the Lapis oil to anyone who won't break out from the fractionated coconut oil.

I have only been using the oil for 2 days but I am already in love with it. I have combination to oily, acne prone, sensitive skin. I have tried many facial oils and the majority of them are somewhat heavy for my skin. This one is very light, absorbs quickly and does have some effect on oil balancing. My face still produces oil but is significant less than before. No breakout yet from these 2 days. I also love the size of the oil which comes in 1.7oz instead of 1oz. Money well spent with satisfying result :)

This oil has changed my skin for the better. Despite trying every prescription and non-prescription product to get rid of persistent white heads on my chin, I would still wake up with a couple every day. This oil has stopped the white heads completely. It's hard to believe the difference. It also leaves your skin with the most beautiful glow. I mix 5-6 drops with my moisturizer both night and day. I am 45 years old.

I have been struggling with acne and moderate breakouts for 15 years. I have literally tried EVERYTHING from drugstore to LaMer and everything in between. I have used this oil for two weeks and my complexion has completely changed! The texture of my skin is amazing and the breakouts are gone!

I have sensitive dry skin and I don't have much acne but what interested me in this was the anti-inflammatory ingredients. I get red inflamed skin with the occasional poor diet and sun exposure. I've been using this for a few weeks every night, and wearing it under my foundation on the days i don't see much sun. It's life changing, it truly is. I thought my pores would be clogged but somehow they are disappearing, especially on my nose. A little goes a long way and I'm not even skimming at the top of the bottle, I'm actually worried this will go bad by the time I'm even halfway. I love it and I can see what the big deal is!
It helps my sensitive skin stay calm. I use it nightly. It helps heal little broken out areas as well.

I have had sensitive skin ever since I started using retinol. I am on week two with this and it has been wonderful! No break outs and the dry spots on my face are gone. The smell is pleasant and it absorbs well. My husband also uses it and is loving it. He actually has way more sensitive skin (around the eye area), so that says something. The amount of product is worth the price.

I have to mention that Lapis contains the same ingredient as Sunday Riley's Luna Oil and is slightly less expensive -- although still pricey. I'll be reviewing Luna oil at a later date. The oil looks heavy but actually it is quite lightweight and the absorption is decent. If you have dry skin like me, the oil will soak up faster but with minimal application -- a few drops -- all skin types can work this into their routine. The blue tint does not show up on the skin as much as in the Luna oil and the fragrance is fresh. If you didn't know, tansey oil comes mainly from German Chamomile flowers. Don't quote me on that...  I love that the silky oil glides easily over my skin without any sticky residue and it's made out of natural ingredients -- plus it's cruelty-free. Also, I found that it's soothing on the skin after a facial or glycolic peel due to the azulene element. Azulene used to be a spa secret back in the day. It was applied on the skin after peeling or waxing to cool the irritation and redness. I always had a hard time finding Azulene oil so I'm glad it's available here. I would consider buying this in the future although the price is not something I'm keen about. The upside is that the oil will last you a long time and the gorgeous glass bottle and dropper applicator are additional cool features.
Very nice lightweight oil for everyday use. I'm so happy Sephora carries this brand!

I have sensitive, acne prone skin. I'm in my late twenties and female. I have been making the switch over to more natural products. I bought the clay bar soap and rose coconut spray as well.  I highly recommend this product. It takes a few days to get used to, and don't use too much. My skin instantly glows, and after the first few days my acne scars and hyper pigmentation calmed down. My nose especially has had the biggest change, with clear pores and they're beginning to shrink. It does make your foundation slippery though. Four stars for natural, glory healthy oil. Minus one for price and making my concealer slip.

If youre looking for a face oil other than Josie Maran's argan oil, this one is worth a shot. I have oily combo skin and I only use this at night. Doesnt break me out and when i wake up my face is pretty much matte instead of oily - so I believe my skin has slowly absorbed it throughout the night! The only drawback is the price because it is really pricey for a face oil but for me, a little goes a long way and I only use it at night so I imagine this to last me quite some time.

This is a beautiful  formula. It sinks perfectly on the skin leaving a healthy appearance. I have also discovered 2 drops of this is the perfect solution for the Drunk Elephant SPF rolling issues. It has made its way to my regular skin care day routine.
I have super sensitive skin and perioral dermatitis.  This oil is wonderful.  Calms redness and moisturizes.  The rest of my face is glowing.  Worth the splurge.

This face oil is lightweight and provides some hydration but that's about it. For the price, you would expect it to help with pores or skin texture but it doesn't do that. The smell is mild and this would be a good face oil if you are looking only for mild hydration and nothing else.

This oil is astonishingly good and I don't think I will ever be without it. First impressions were that the packaging was gorgeous and that the smell was fantastic. It smells a bit like Sunday Riley's Luna but also smells like pine. Unlike Luna however, the scent is very mild and not overwhelming at all.  I have never tried a facial oil that absorbs this fast. I've tried Luna, Artemis, Argan, Argan Light, Tsubaki, Pure Truth, and more. I used three drops at first, but it absorbed so effortlessly I kept adding more even thought my skin felt instantly moisturizer. Ten drops absorbed flawlessly and after a mere 3-5 minutes felt only like I had put on a deeply nourishing cream, with no oily residue at all.  Blue tansy is also one of my favourite ingredients. Although I don't have much redness, only a few blemishes here and there, I find it really helps calm and even my skin.  Love!

It is only my 5th day using this product & I was skeptical at first. The scent this product has really revives your senses and made my skin significantly soft after the first use. I had seen in other reviews that it caused some breakouts, but I have sensitive skin & mild acne and have seen a significant transformation. My acne cleared up and my skin is the softest it's ever been. I now feel confident wearing no make up through out the day & that is something I have not been able to say for a long while. I use this oil along with Boscia face wash.

I purchased this oil as I read the reviews and wanted to give it a go. I have been trying to purchase natural products as I use up what I have. I am so happy with the purchase of this product. It is amazing. I have had this issue where my forehead has all of these little bumps on it, they weren't pimples or a rash and I just could not get rid of them. After 3 nights of using this they dramatically decreased in appearance and after about a week they are almost completely gone. Not only this but I also had flaky skin on my forehead and nose (flaky and oily, it never made sense to me). Well, low and behold, this oil completely cleared up the flaky skin as well. I am so happy with this purchase.   Also, I know the price seems high but you get a good amount of product. I only use 4-6 drops per night and that seems to work for me. I feel like this will last me a LONG time!!! Hope this helps :)

Obsessed with this oil. I began my love of serums with caudalie's detox oil- but found my face beginning to feel just a tiny bit too greasy. Switched to this and it is perfect. I have combination skin prone to minor hormonal breakouts- this helps to keep skin clear and oil at bay, while also having a fantastic scent.

I wish I could post a picture. My oil is a dark brown, greenish color and it smells...old? NOT what I expected in a $75 bottle of face oil! Anyone else experience this? Highly disappointed! I just can't put this on my face! Back it goes...

I really liked the first bottle of Lapis that I ordered. It was a brighter blue, smelled stronger of blue raspberry, and was a fantastic product until the eyedropper and cap kept on breaking. I returned that one and ordered a new bottle. But this time the color was way off (a greyish green), the smell was more cardboardy and not nearly as strong, and over all I could tell this bottle was just old. I returned that one as well. The amount of inconsistency between the two was crazy. It's too much of a gamble for me to buy these as I've had issues with both bottles.   If you can get yourself a fresh bottle that doesn't break though, this is one of the best face oils on the market. Just make sure you keep the receipt.

reviews.review_title: Oil skeptic is a skeptic no more
